events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at the intersection. No severe injuries were noted.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and collision details submitted by the insured.
An experienced claims agent has been assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim to ensure smooth processing.
The insurance company has officially acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and informed the claimant of the next steps.
Requested police report and photos of the vehicle damage from the claimant to validate details of the vehicle collision incident.
Claimant submitted all requested documentation, including police report, vehicle photos, and witness statements, enabling further review.
Investigation into the circumstances of the car accident has begun, including verification of submitted documents and statements.
Investigation concluded successfully with confirmation of the collision details and assessment of the vehicle damage completed.
A settlement offer has been proposed based on the damage assessment and policy coverage limits for the auto accident claim.
The claimant provided positive feedback regarding the ease of communication and fairness of the proposed settlement offer.
The claim has been officially approved following the claimant's acceptance of the settlement proposal and verification of all criteria.
Payment for the approved auto accident claim has been issued to the claimantâ€™s designated bank account as per policy terms.
The auto accident claim case has been closed following the successful payment and confirmation with the claimant.
All documents and records related to the auto accident claim have been archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
